intro: Gosela eckloniana, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms. Gosela eckloniana is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
